result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Edward Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
Good time.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

No contact with M.C., J.L., or their immediate family.
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.  Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
Defendant is not to possess or consume any prescription medication.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Edward Adams

Defendant Kyle Edward Adams in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.  Defendant Kyle Edward Adams in custody.  Kent R. Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:00
Court is being heard
ADA takes no issue with the PSI
Atty Smith is being heard on PSI
ADA is being heard on recommendation
Atty Smith is being heard
Def is being heard
Court Orders:
Imposed & Stayed sentence of 1 Year Jail - consecutive to any other sentence with good time and huber release if in compliance with jails rules and regulations.
18 Month Probation - consecutive to his Michigan sentence
Not allowed to vote or sit on jury until civil rights are restored.  Not allowed to possess firearms.
Costs and service fees - work out payment with agent
71 days jail - credit for 71 days
No contact with M.C., J.L., or their immediate family
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.  
Def is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing, or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Def is not to consume or possess any prescription medication without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by your agent.
Obtain or maintain full-time employment; or part-time employment if enrolled in school
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
